required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: DAILIES TOTAL1® - Comparative Assessment of Tear Film Evaporation
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study on the Effect of Daily Disposable Silicone Hydrogel Contact Lenses on Tear Film Lipids

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the tear film evaporation of symptomatic soft contact lens wearers in the absence of contact lens wear and after at least 8 hours of contact lens wear.

detailed_description.textblock: This study will consist of 5 visits (1 screening, 4 assessment) with a maximum of 6 days between assessment visits with at least 24 hours of no lens wear the day prior to the visit. Each subject will be randomized to wear 3 different study lenses for at least 8 hours each and one 8 hour day of no lens wear in a specific sequence. This study will be conducted in Australia.

primary_outcome.description: A non-invasive measurement of tear evaporation will be taken with study contact lenses or no lens as applicable. The evaporation rate will be calculated.

arm_group.description: Delefilcon A contact lenses, narafilcon A contact lenses, and somofilcon A contact lenses worn bilaterally (in both eyes) in cross-over fashion as randomized. Each product worn for one day, 8 hours minimum.
One 8-hour day of no lens wear

intervention.description: Daily disposable, silicone hydrogel contact lenses used according to manufacturer's instructions
Daily disposable, silicone hydrogel contact lenses used according to manufacturer's instructions
Daily disposable, silicone hydrogel contact lenses used according to manufacturer's instructions
